name: RPA.FileSystem
doc: FileSystem is a library for finding, creating, and modifying files on a local filesystem.

keywords.name: Absolute Path
keywords.doc:
Returns the absolute path to a file, and resolves symlinks.

param path:path that will be resolved
return:absolute path to file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the absolute path to a file, and resolves symlinks.

keywords.name: Append To Binary File
keywords.doc:
Appends binary content to the given file.

param path:path to file to append to
param content:content to append
keywords.shortdoc: Appends binary content to the given file.

keywords.name: Append To File
keywords.doc:
Appends text to the given file.

param path:path to file to append to
param content:content to append
param encoding:character encoding of appended content
keywords.shortdoc: Appends text to the given file.

keywords.name: Change File Extension
keywords.doc:
Replaces file extension for file at given path.

param path:path to file to rename
param extension:
 new extension, e.g. .xlsx
keywords.shortdoc: Replaces file extension for file at given path.

keywords.name: Copy Directory
keywords.doc:
Copy directory from source path to destination path.

param source:path to source directory
param destination:
 path to copy destination
keywords.shortdoc: Copy directory from source path to destination path.

keywords.name: Copy File
keywords.doc:
Copy a file from source path to destination path.

param source:path to source file
param destination:
 path to copy destination
keywords.shortdoc: Copy a file from source path to destination path.

keywords.name: Copy Files
keywords.doc:
Copy multiple files to destination folder.

param sources:list of source files
param destination:
 path to destination folder
keywords.shortdoc: Copy multiple files to destination folder.

keywords.name: Create Binary File
keywords.doc:
Creates a new binary file, and writes content if any is given.

param path:path to file to write
param content:content to write to file (optional)
param overwrite:
 replace destination file if it already exists
keywords.shortdoc: Creates a new binary file, and writes content if any is given.

keywords.name: Create Directory
keywords.doc:
Creates a directory and (optionally) non-existing parent directories.

param path:path to new directory
param parents:create missing parent directories
param exist_ok:continue without errors if directory already exists
keywords.shortdoc: Creates a directory and (optionally) non-existing parent directories.

keywords.name: Create File
keywords.doc:
Creates a new text file, and writes content if any is given.

param path:path to file to write
param content:content to write to file (optional)
param encoding:character encoding of written content
param overwrite:
 replace destination file if it already exists
keywords.shortdoc: Creates a new text file, and writes content if any is given.

keywords.name: Does Directory Exist
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the given directory exists, False if not.

param path:path to inspected directory
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the given directory exists, False if not.

keywords.name: Does Directory Not Exist
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the directory does not exist, False if it does.

param path:path to inspected directory
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the directory does not exist, False if it does.

keywords.name: Does File Exist
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the given file exists, False if not.

param path:path to inspected file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the given file exists, False if not.

keywords.name: Does File Not Exist
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the file does not exist, False if it does.

param path:path to inspected file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the file does not exist, False if it does.

keywords.name: Empty Directory
keywords.doc:
Removes all the files in the given directory.

param path:directory to remove files from
keywords.shortdoc: Removes all the files in the given directory.

keywords.name: Find Files
keywords.doc:
Find files recursively according to a pattern.

param pattern:search path in glob format pattern, e.g. .xls or */orders.txt
param include_dirs:
 include directories in results
param include_files:
 include files in results
return:list of paths that match the pattern
keywords.shortdoc: Find files recursively according to a pattern.

keywords.name: Get File Creation Date
keywords.doc:
Returns the creation time in seconds. Note: Linux sets this whenever file metadata changes

param path:path to file to inspect
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the creation time in seconds. Note: Linux sets this whenever file metadata changes

keywords.name: Get File Extension
keywords.doc:
Returns the suffix for the file.

param path:path to file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the suffix for the file.

keywords.name: Get File Modified Date
keywords.doc:
Returns the modified time in seconds.

param path:path to file to inspect
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the modified time in seconds.

keywords.name: Get File Name
keywords.doc:
Returns only the filename portion of a path.

param path:path to file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns only the filename portion of a path.

keywords.name: Get File Size
keywords.doc:
Returns the file size in bytes.

param path:path to file to inspect
keywords.shortdoc: Returns the file size in bytes.

keywords.name: Is Directory Empty
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the given directory has no files or subdirectories.

param path:path to inspected directory
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the given directory has no files or subdirectories.

keywords.name: Is Directory Not Empty
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the given directory has any files or subdirectories.

param path:path to inspected directory
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the given directory has any files or subdirectories.

keywords.name: Is File Empty
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the given file has no content, i.e. has zero size.

param path:path to inspected file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the given file has no content, i.e. has zero size.

keywords.name: Is File Not Empty
keywords.doc:
Returns True if the given file has content, i.e. larger than zero size.

param path:path to inspected file
keywords.shortdoc: Returns True if the given file has content, i.e. larger than zero size.

keywords.name: Join Path
keywords.doc:
Joins multiple parts of a path together.

param parts:Components of the path, e.g. dir, subdir, filename.ext
keywords.shortdoc: Joins multiple parts of a path together.

keywords.name: List Directories In Directory
keywords.doc:
Lists all the directories in the given directory, relative to it.

param path:base directory for search, defaults to current working dir
keywords.shortdoc: Lists all the directories in the given directory, relative to it.

keywords.name: List Files In Directory
keywords.doc:
Lists all the files in the given directory, relative to it.

param path:base directory for search, defaults to current working dir
keywords.shortdoc: Lists all the files in the given directory, relative to it.

keywords.name: Log Directory Tree
keywords.doc:
Logs all the files in the directory recursively.

param path:base directory to start from, defaults to current working dir
keywords.shortdoc: Logs all the files in the directory recursively.

keywords.name: Move Directory
keywords.doc:
Move a directory from source path to destination path.

param source:source directory path for moving
param destination:
 path to move to
param overwrite:
 replace destination directory if it already exists
keywords.shortdoc: Move a directory from source path to destination path.

keywords.name: Move File
keywords.doc:
Move a file from source path to destination path, optionally overwriting the destination.

param source:source file path for moving
param destination:
 path to move to
param overwrite:
 replace destination file if it already exists
keywords.shortdoc: Move a file from source path to destination path, optionally overwriting the destination.

keywords.name: Move Files
keywords.doc:
Move multiple files to the destination folder.

param sources:list of files to move
param destination:
 path to move destination
param overwrite:
 replace destination files if they already exist
keywords.shortdoc: Move multiple files to the destination folder.

keywords.name: Normalize Path
keywords.doc:
Removes redundant separators or up-level references from path.

param path:path that will be normalized
return:path to file
keywords.shortdoc: Removes redundant separators or up-level references from path.

keywords.name: Read Binary File
keywords.doc:
Reads a file in binary mode and returns the content. Does not attempt to decode the content in any way.

param path:path to file to read
keywords.shortdoc: Reads a file in binary mode and returns the content. Does not attempt to decode the content in any way.

keywords.name: Read File
keywords.doc:
Reads a file as text, with given encoding, and returns the content."

param path:path to file to read
param encoding:character encoding of file
keywords.shortdoc: Reads a file as text, with given `encoding`, and returns the content."

keywords.name: Remove Directory
keywords.doc:
Removes the given directory, and optionally everything it contains.

param path:path to directory
param recursive:
 remove all subdirectories and files
keywords.shortdoc: Removes the given directory, and optionally everything it contains.

keywords.name: Remove File
keywords.doc:
Removes the given file.

param path:path to the file to remove
param missing_ok:
 ignore non-existent file
keywords.shortdoc: Removes the given file.

keywords.name: Remove Files
keywords.doc:
Removes multiple files.

param paths:paths to files to be removed
param missing_ok:
 ignore non-existent files
keywords.shortdoc: Removes multiple files.

keywords.name: Run Keyword If File Exists
keywords.doc:
If file exists at path, execute given keyword with arguments.

Example

Run keyword if file exists    orders.xlsx    Process orders
param path:path to file to inspect
param keyword:Robot Framework keyword to execute
param args:arguments to keyword
keywords.shortdoc: If file exists at `path`, execute given keyword with arguments.

keywords.name: Touch File
keywords.doc:
Creates a file with no content, or if file already exists, updates the modification and access times.

param path:path to file which is touched
keywords.shortdoc: Creates a file with no content, or if file already exists, updates the modification and access times.

keywords.name: Wait Until Created
keywords.doc:
Poll path until it exists, or raise exception if timeout is reached.

param path:path to poll
param timeout:time in seconds until keyword fails
keywords.shortdoc: Poll path until it exists, or raise exception if timeout is reached.

keywords.name: Wait Until Modified
keywords.doc:
Poll path until it has been modified after the keyword was called, or raise exception if timeout is reached.

param path:path to poll
param timeout:time in seconds until keyword fails
keywords.shortdoc: Poll path until it has been modified after the keyword was called, or raise exception if timeout is reached.

keywords.name: Wait Until Removed
keywords.doc:
Poll path until it doesn't exist, or raise exception if timeout is reached.

param path:path to poll
param timeout:time in seconds until keyword fails
keywords.shortdoc: Poll path until it doesn't exist, or raise exception if timeout is reached.
